name: Napa Valley Lodge

reviews.text: I traveled with my family and we loved the free breakfast. The rooms were amazing and the pool is beautiful and a great place to get together with friends and family. The rooms and bathrooms were very spacious, clean and comfortable. The lobby is very nice and enjoyed the afternoon cookies and wine tasting. The staff was very courteous and helpful and went above and beyond to assist my family. Our room was right off the pool and was so peaceful and quiet. Can't wait to return next year.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel with Great Views and Free Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great service --- went out of their way to help arrange for last minute stay, and worked with us to ensure room met our needs.
reviews.title: Lovely, relaxing, rejuvenating, romantic stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoyed pool, hot tub, beautiful gardens and fountain, and especially sunset overlooking the vineyards.
reviews.title: Romantic, Quaint, Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: Can't wait for our next opportunity to get away to the Napa Valley Lodge!
reviews.title: We wished we could have stayed longer...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, very easy to find and convenient to many vineyards and restaurants. Breakfast is included and was very delicious and much more than I expected. The view of the vineyard from my room was amazing. The beds are so comfortable I wish I had one like it at home (along with the linens). The pool area is beautiful and very relaxing. The maid service was impeccable and can't wait to visit again. The staff was very helpful and accommodating.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If your room is on the main highway, don't count on getting any sleep. Everyone owns a truck or motorcycle. Good luck on a view of the vinyards that the web site shows. On the wood burning fireplace, can you say "Duraflame". Same some bucks, not worth the money.
reviews.title: Not what we expected!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not being able to get the booking we wanted in another property in a place that is the first time for us to visit, we opted with the Napa Valley Lodge.
reviews.title: Lacking....

reviews.text: When we checked in, as my husband and I would typically expect, we were not advised of amenities, privileges, services available unless we've asked for it ourselves. Either we have both been well pampered by various other hotels we have stayed in or this property does not really care.
reviews.title: Paradise & Wine Valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They also have a silly housekeeping arrangement whereby a team takes care of doing your bed and removing every used towels in the bathroom; and another team that does the cleaning and the replenishment of the cleared bathroom toiletries afterwards. Hence, when my husband and I came back from breakfast the first day to find there are no towels or wash soaps to clean up before venturing outside, we had no choice but to call housekeeping. Only after that did they do the replenishing.
reviews.title: Quintessential Napa Valley Hotel w/Top-Notch Service

reviews.text: Fine, but on the second day, the same incident happened again prompting my husband to call them for the toiletries and then only at that time be advised that is is actually their procedure. Unfortunately we do not have mind-reading capabilities to know that unless advised in advance.
reviews.title: Comfortable, charming and fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to San Francisco and Napa Valley for our 3 year anniversary. The hotel is in a great location. Yountville is right in the middle of Napa Valley with easy access to Napa town in the south and Calistoga in the north. I am glad we chose this area. It is a short walk to the little town of Yountville. The hotel decor is beautiful. The room was great. It overlooked the pool area, bocce court, and the firepit with vineyards in the distance. The room had a fireplace and a balcony and great bathroom. The bed was very comfortable. The breakfast, which was included, was great. Waffles, fruit, cereal, eggs, granola, bagles, pastries, mimosas- Enough to satisfy. Overall, we loved this hotel!
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stay for 2 nights at the "Lodge." Rooms are very large and spacious. The women at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was nice and the staff helpful. Beautiful view from our room and the surroundings. Pool area clean, quiet, and relaxing. Good location. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent value for the money compared to other hotels in the area.
Great hotel in beautiful Napa
reviews.text: Room was spacious and clean. I was pleasantly surprised with the large bathroom especially. It felt luxurious. We were traveling with an infant, and the hotel was accomodating, providing a nice clean crib for her. The hotel is on the end of the town, but the walk is quick--you're really right in the (quiet) middle of everything here. No complaints from these picky travelers!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After our amazing wedding we were able to stay at the Napa Valley Lodge. It was the first night as husband and wife and we were so happy that we could be at this lodge. Such a relaxing time before heading out on our honeymoon. Wonderful friendly service, great quiet lush room. Top comfort when you need it the most after a long day....and year of planning our wedding.
reviews.title: First night as Husband and Wife

reviews.text: I loved this hotel & what a great location in the "HEART" of wine country. All the greatest wineries were only blocks away.
reviews.title: A business trip that felt like a vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here three nights while exploring the Napa Valley recently. It's a very nice property with well kept grounds and a professional staff. The room we had on the second floor was fairly large and very clean, with a nice size balcony. Our check in experience was fine, but the staff is not very forthcoming about local attractions, restaurants, etc. until you drag it out of them. Also they didn't mention the morning breakfast at all and I had to call them to determine where it was located. The breakfast iteself is pretty plain when you consider what you're paying for this place per night.- not impressive compared to other similar properties we have stayed at around the country.
reviews.title: Not a lodge, but quite nice......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You also have to play "where's the hairdyer" - it's hidden in the closet within a black bag, but after hanging clothes in the closet I defy you to find it. Once locate it worked just fine as did everything else in the room. Parking is free and quite convenient to the rooms. Nice pool area as well.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Amenities but Rooms Need A Facelift
Nice place- a bit of an organization problem
reviews.text: Don't think "lodge" when you consider this hotel because it is nothing like a "lodge" as it looks from the street as an upscale motel with outside room entrances. From our point of view it doesn't quite live up to the price charged for a room, but everyone is going to have a different perspective on that and hey, it's in the Napa Valley. But is it quite a nice place, yes it is and we would recommend it to others with a few caveats.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hard to go wrong with staying in Yountville. The Napa Valley Lodge is decent, with a really nice courtyard. Would love to see the rooms redone. Get the feeling of staying in an 80's style lodge that needs dusting. The rooms are plenty big enough, just need an interior remodel. Nonetheless, a wonderful place to stay especially given the reasonable price.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked this hotel and probably just caught in during a few days when they weren't at their best. The location was good, the room was very nice and the staff was always pleasant. Upon our arrival, we were a bit early so they recommended we go to Goosecreek Winery- which was very good and our favorite winery during our stay in Napa! We got back and were checked in to a room with a view of the winery and a great fireplace.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Napa!!

description: Located in the heart of Napa Valley, in the charming town of Yountville, the Napa Valley Lodge is just steps away from world-renowned restaurants, specialty shops, and award winning wine tasting rooms. The Lodge is set in a vineyard in a quiet setting away from the hustle and bustle of Yountville, but within easy strolling distance. Our property is designed in the Tuscan villa style and adorned with lush landscaping and thoughtful details at every turn, from trickling fountains to our popular outdoor fire pit and serene pool area. The Lodge welcomes you with a friendly and experienced staff that is committed to making your stay as special as possible.The Napa Valley Lodge's 55 guestrooms are spacious, private, and graciously furnished. Our guestrooms feature private verandahs, many with courtyard, garden, or vineyard views, vaulted ceilings, and fireplaces. A Champagne continental breakfast buffet is served complimentary every morning from 8:00am-10:00am.All rooms are non-smoking, have deluxe honor bars, complimentary wireless internet (WiFi) access, flat screen TVs, iPod docking stations, On-Command video, desks, and fresh brewed coffee. All guest bathrooms have been completely renovated with walk-in glass showers, granite vanity counters, and limestone floors. For your convenience, our guestrooms include irons, ironing boards, two plush micro fiber robes, hair dryers and a variety of complimentary personal amenities.
